CatDescriptText: Mrs. Charles Charleton, 509 Gearing Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "Most people that I know follow the politician to a great extent.  Really, I don't know the reason why.  Perhaps it's because they believe that the politician can do more for them than the minister."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Charles Charleton, wearing earrings, light colored dress with flower attached to top button, and light colored cardigan, holding items and dark handbag over left arm, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
